Articles.Content:
Hello everyone, I'm Gadgethm. I'm not posting this in Welcome aboard because I have already posted a "Hello my name is..." thread. However, that thread was about 6 months ago and I haven't made a significant number of posts since. (After all, I am secretly known to be a lurker) Anyway, just to keep this interesting, I bring forth pictures from the planet Duna! See them and rejoice!

The Awesome ShotImage of the landing site.Duna herself in sunlit glory

I hope to become more active in these forums, to be honest, I'm the sort of guy who listens and doesn't post; so who knows?

Stay cool and keep up the awesome, KSP community!

-Gadgethm

Edited September 23, 2012 by Gadgethm

im the same to be honest, i liek to lurk and listen instead of get involved

wish i could get to duna aswell but iv got the missus round since the update n she aint lettin me play lmao
Gratz on the Duna landing, what planet you planning next?

im orbiting Duna currently with my damaged lander. The space kraken has returned and torn my transfer stage apart and torn a tank and engine off.

1 tank down 3 left. guys can i still land on duna due to the asymmetrical thrust?
Post pics of your lander, but based on me hearing th words engine torn off and asymmetrical thrust.. I'd have to say no
I've had nothing but bad experiences with missing engines, lol. You can try with very, VERY low thrust, maybe you can keep from lawndarting... have your finger ready on that EVA button though.
how the heck did you land that thing? its got no propulsion! is just 3 small parachutes enough to land with 20% atmosphere?
